member.name: M:OrmapTaxlotEditing.SpatialUtilities.DoSpatialQuery(ESRI.ArcGIS.Geodatabase.IFeatureClass,ESRI.ArcGIS.Geometry.IGeometry,ESRI.ArcGIS.Geodatabase.esriSpatialRelEnum,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Return a feature cursor based on the results of a spatial query.
member.param: Feature class to search.
Geometry to search in relation to spatialRelation.
Geometry relationship to searchGeometry.
SQL Where clause.
Read/Write state of the return cursor.
member.returns: Returns a feature cursor that represents the results of the spatial query.
member.remarks: Given a feature class, inFeatureClass, a search geometry,searchGeometry , a spatial relationship,spatialRelation , an Sql search statement, whereClause, and whether or not the returned cursor should be updateable, IsUpdateable. Perform a spatial query inFeatureClass where feature which meet criteria whereClause have a relationship of spatialRelation to searchGeometry. The returned cursor is updatable if IsUpdateable is True.

member.name: M:OrmapTaxlotEditing.StringUtilities.#ctor
member.summary: Private empty constructor to prevent instantiation.
member.remarks: This class follows the singleton pattern and thus has a private constructor and all shared members. Instances of types that define only shared members do not need to be created, so no constructor should be needed. However, many compilers will automatically add a public default constructor if no constructor is specified. To prevent this an empty private constructor is added.

member.name: M:OrmapTaxlotEditing.AnnotationUtilities.#ctor
member.summary: Private empty constructor to prevent instantiation.
member.remarks: This class follows the singleton pattern and thus has a private constructor and all shared members. Instances of types that define only shared members do not need to be created, so no constructor should be needed. However, many compilers will automatically add a public default constructor if no constructor is specified. To prevent this an empty private constructor is added.

member.name: M:OrmapTaxlotEditing.AnnotationUtilities.GetAnnoEnvelope(ESRI.ArcGIS.Display.IDisplay,ESRI.ArcGIS.Carto.IElement)

member.name: M:OrmapTaxlotEditing.AnnotationUtilities.MoveAnnotationElements(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Moves annotation elements based on boolean settings
member.param: Boolean value to determine if annotation should be inverted (rotated)
Boolean value to determine if annotation should be transposed (flipped)
Boolean value to determine if annotation should be moved "up"
Boolean value to determine if annotation should be moved "down"
Boolean value to determine if annotation has standard space
Boolean value to determine if annotation has wide space

remarks.para:
Annotation movement only works for annotation created and placed by the CreateAnnotation class. This class places annotation based on a set of rules which comply with annotation spacing, fonts, and font sizes used in Polk County taxmaps.
Moving distance and bearing annotation is accomplished by describing mathematical relationships relating to a "virtual" line (the taxlot line). Distances between the "upper" and "lower" annotation varies depending on its relative location to this line. Annotation on different sides of the line, both above the line, or both below the line have different distances between them. These distances are calculated relative to the centroid of the annotation's envelopes, and are dependent on font size. These distances also vary if the line is "standard" or "big" (wide). Annotation may be placed with wide spacing if it will be located next to map index boundaries, taxcode lines, subdivision boundaries, etc.
Constants were calculated by checking envelope centroid distances for a number of annotation sets of different scales placed above, below, and on both sides of the line at 100, 200, and 400 scales. These constants were calculated from the formula:
remarks.code:
K = Distance / FontSize
and work out to the following values:
Anno Location K -------------- ---- Both Sides 2.55 Both Above 1.75 Both Below 1.99

member.name: M:OrmapTaxlotEditing.DataMonitor.#ctor
member.summary: Private empty constructor to prevent instantiation.
member.remarks: This class follows the singleton pattern and thus has a private constructor and all shared members. Instances of types that define only shared members do not need to be created, so no constructor should be needed. However, many compilers will automatically add a public default constructor if no constructor is specified. To prevent this an empty private constructor is added.

member.name: M:OrmapTaxlotEditing.DataMonitor.SendExtinctToCancelledNumbersTable(ESRI.ArcGIS.Geodatabase.IFeature,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Captures the mapnumber and taxlot and records them in the CancelledNumbers table if they are extinct.
member.param: The feature to get the numbers from.
Whether the check is being called from within an OnChange event handler.

remarks.para: Taxlots will send their numbers to the CancelledNumbers table ONLY if they are "extinct" (unique in the map at the time of deletion/change).
If this check is being called from within an OnChange event handler, then it will use the feature's original values rather than its current values.
Features with null or non-numeric values will not be written to the table. This will effectively exclude roads, rails, water, and nontl polygons which have non-numeric Taxlot field values.
